Description: Rim and body sherd (four joining fragments) with handle root of early Chian pottery patterned chalice with cul; white slip; interior: reserved band around rim and glazed streaky black below; traces of two added white bands; below, at top of cul, white band; exterior: narrow black band on edge of rim; faded brown band above cul; on cul, double saw-edged metope pattern between two c brown bands with group of six vertical lines on right and group of five vertical lines preserved on left; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA274 and Reading 26.2.63. Lemos (1991, 12) explains that this chalice 'belongs to a group of chalices with broad bowls decorated on the handle zone with two saw-edged patterns flanked by three sets of stripes, which appear on the other side of the vessel'.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 231, pl. 6, no. 66)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0314) (phase 2)
